Linked List Implementation

Sample Input/Output

86 987 76 69 71 80 1009 20 -987
The linked list is:
20-->69-->71-->76-->80-->86-->987-->1009-->NULL
3876 2 23 125 187 579 1235 2909 3176 17 123 0
The linked list is:
2-->17-->23-->123-->125-->187-->579-->1235-->2909-->3176-->3876-->NULL
-1
The list is empty

C Source Code

#include<stdio.h>
#include<stdlib.h>

typedef struct node {
  int data;
  struct node *next;
} Node;

Node *insertToList(Node *head, int n);
Node * createNode(int n);
void printList(Node *head);
void freelist(Node *head);

int main()
{
  Node *head=NULL;
  int n, i;

  scanf("%d", &n);
  while (n>0) {
    head=insertToList(head, n);
    scanf("%d", &n);
  }
  printList(head);
  freelist(head);
}

/* Insert a record into the list headed by head. *
 * The list is maintained in ascending order     *
 * according to the data stored in the records   */
Node *insertToList(Node *head, int n)
{
  Node *p, *parent, *pn;

  if (head == NULL) {
    head = createNode(n);
    if (head == NULL) { 
      printf("not enough memory\n");
      exit(1);
    }
  }
  else { /* head != NULL */
    if (n <= head->data) { /* The new node should be the first on the list */
       pn = createNode(n);
       if (pn != NULL) {
          pn->next = head;
          head = pn;   
       }
       else {
          printf("not enough memory\n");
          freelist(head);
          exit(1);
       }
    } 
    else { /* The new node is not the first on the list */
       parent = head;
       p = parent->next;
       while ((p!=NULL) && (n > p->data)) {
          parent = p;
          p=p->next;
       }
       if (p!=NULL) { /* n <= p->data */
          pn = createNode(n);
          if (pn != NULL) {
             pn->next = p;
             parent->next = pn;
          }
          else {
             printf("Not enough memory\n");
             freelist(head);
             exit(1);
          }
       }
       else { /* When p==NULL, insert the node into the end of the list */
          pn = createNode(n);
          if (pn != NULL) 
             parent->next = pn;
          else {
             printf("Not enough memory\n");
             freelist(head);
             exit(1);
          } 
       }
    } 
  }
  return(head);
}

/* Create a node of type Node */
Node * createNode(int n)
{
  Node *p;
  
  p = (Node *)malloc(sizeof(Node));
  if (p == NULL)
     return(NULL);
  p->data = n;
  p->next = NULL;
  return(p);
}

/* Print to the standard output the integers *
 * stored in the list                        */
void printList(Node *head) 
{
  Node *p;
  if (head == NULL)
     printf("The list is empty\n");
  else {
    printf("The linked list is:\n");
    for (p=head; p!=NULL; p=p->next) {
       printf("%d-->", p->data);
    }
    printf("NULL\n");
  }
}

/* Free the memory space occupied by the *
 * list headed by head                   */ 
void freelist(Node *head)
{
  Node *p, *q;

  p = head;
  while (p!=NULL) {
    q = p->next;
    free(p);
    p = q;
  }
}

Bourne Shell

I wrote this shell script to read information using ANSI C as a DBMS would

#!/bin/sh
printf 'Grock- '
read command
while test "$command" != "quit"
do
  case $command in
    setdb*) 
      set $command
      if test $1 = "setdb"
      then
        if test $# -eq 1
        then
          echo Missing Argument.
        else
          database=$2
          if test ! -e $database
          then
            echo File $database does not exist.
          elif test ! -r $database
          then
            echo File $database is not readable.
          else
            cat $database | egrep '^[^ ]+[ ][^ ]+[ ][^ ]+$' | diff $database - > /dev/null
            if test $? = 0
            then
              echo Database set to $database
            else
              echo Incorrect format in $database.
              echo The following lines were incorrectly formatted.
              cat $database | egrep -v '^[^ ]+[ ][^ ]+[ ][^ ]+$'
              echo Database not set.
            fi
          fi
          if test $# -gt 2
          then
            echo Extra arguments ignored.
          fi
        fi
      else
        echo Unrecognized command.
      fi
      ;;
    *) echo Unrecognized command.;;
  esac
printf 'Grock- '
read command
done

Script

#!/bin/sh
printf 'Grock- '
read command
while test "$command" != "quit"
do
  case $command in
    setdb*) 
      set $command
      if test $1 = "setdb"
      then
        if test $# -eq 1
        then
          echo Missing Argument.
        else
          database=$2
          if test ! -e $database
          then
            echo File $database does not exist.
          elif test ! -r $database
          then
            echo File $database is not readable.
          else
            cat $database | egrep '^[^ ]+[ ][^ ]+[ ][^ ]+$' | diff $database - > /dev/null
            if test $? = 0
            then
              echo Database set to $database
            else
              echo Incorrect format in $database.
              echo The following lines were incorrectly formatted.
              cat $database | egrep -v '^[^ ]+[ ][^ ]+[ ][^ ]+$'
              database=""
              echo Database not set.
            fi
          fi
          if test $# -gt 2
          then
            echo Extra arguments ignored.
          fi
        fi
      else
        echo Unrecognized command.
      fi
      ;;
    relnames)
      if test "X$database" = "X"
      then
        echo Database has not been set.
      else
        cat $database | cut -f1 -d" " | sort | uniq 
      fi
    ;;
    entities)
      if test "X$database" = "X"
      then
        echo Database has not been set.
      else
        cat $database | cut -f2,3 -d" " | tr ' ' '\n' | sort | uniq 
      fi
    ;;
    cardinality*)
      if test "X$database" = "X"
      then
        echo Database has not been set.
      else
        set $command
        if test $1 = "cardinality"
        then
          if test $# -eq 1
          then
            echo Missing Argument.
          else
            shift
            relations=`cat $database | cut -f1 -d" " | sort | uniq`
            for relation in $*
            do
              echo "$relations" | grep "^$relation$" > /dev/null
              if test ! $? -eq 0
              then
                echo Relation $relation does not exist. 
              else
                echo $relation `cat $database | grep "^$relation" | wc -l`
              fi
            done
          fi
        else
          echo Unrecognized command.
        fi
      fi
      ;;
    *) echo Unrecognized command.;;
  esac
  printf 'Grock- '
  read command
done

C Pointers â€¦

#include <stdio.h>

int main() {
  int i = 89, *pi=&i;
  double d = 167.9, *pd=&d;
  char c = 'H', *pc=&c;

  printf("The integer value is %d, its address is 0x%x, its memory size is %d bytes.\n\n", i, &i, sizeof(i));
  printf("The value of the integer pointer is 0x%x, its address is 0x%x, its memory size is %d bytes.\n\n", pi, &pi, sizeof(pi));

  printf("The double value is %f, its address is 0x%x, its memory size is %d bytes.\n\n", d, &d, sizeof(d));
  printf("The value of the double pointer is 0x%x, its address is 0x%x, its memory size is %d bytes.\n\n", pd, &pd, sizeof(pd));

  printf("The character value is %c, its address is 0x%x, its memory size is %d byte.\n\n", c, &c, sizeof(c));
  printf("The value of the character pointer is 0x%x, its address is 0x%x, its memory size is %d bytes.\n\n", pc, &pc, sizeof(pc));
}

BMI Calculator

#include <stdio.h>

void convert(float *pweight, float *pheight) {
  *pweight = *pweight * 2.2046; 
  *pheight = *pheight * 0.3937; 
}

int computeBMI(float w, float h, float *pbmi) {
  
  *pbmi = (703*w/(h*h));
  if (*pbmi<18.5)
     return 1;
  else if (*pbmi<25)
     return 2;
  else if (*pbmi<30)
     return 3;
  else 
     return 4;
}

int main() {

  float weight, height, bmi;
  int category;
 
  printf("Please enter your weight in kilograms: "); 
  scanf("%f", &weight); 
  printf("Please enter your height in centimeters: ");
  scanf("%f", &height);

  convert(&weight, &height);

  category = computeBMI(weight, height, &bmi);
  printf("Your BMI value is %.1f and you are ", bmi);

  switch (category) {
    case 1:
      printf("underweight.\n");
      break;
    case 2:
      printf("normal.\n");
      break;
    case 3:
      printf("overweight.\n");
      break;
    case 4:
      printf("obese.\n");
      break;
  }
}

Sorting

#include <stdio.h>

void swap(float *x, float *y) {
  float temp;
  temp =*x;
  *x = *y;
  *y =temp;
}

void bubbleSort(float *array, int size) {
  int i;
  int swapped;

  do {
    swapped = 0;
    for (i=0; i<size-1; i++)
      if (array[i]>array[i+1]) { 
         swap(&array[i], &array[i+1]); 
         swapped = 1;
      }
     size--;
   }
   while (swapped);
}
 
int main()
{
  int i, n;
  float array[100];
 
  printf("Please enter the number of values to be sorted: ");
  scanf("%d", &n);
 
  printf("Please enter %d values: ", n);
 
  for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
    scanf("%f", &array[i]);

  bubbleSort(array, n);
 
  printf("Sorted list in ascending order:\n");
 
  for (i = 0 ; i < n-1 ; i++)
     printf("%.1f ", array[i]);

  printf("%.1f\n", array[i]);
 
  return 0;
}

Substring

#include <stdio.h>

int substr(const char* s1, const char *s2) {

  int i=0, j;
  while (s1[i]!=0) {
    j=0;
    while ((s2[j]==s1[i])&&(s2[j]!=0)&&(s1[i]!=0)) {
      i++;
      j++;
    }
    if (s2[j]==0)
      return 1;
    if (s1[i]==0)
      break;
    if (j==0) /* when s2[j]!=s1[i] and no partial match has occurred */ 
      i++;
  }
  return 0;
}

int main() {
  char string1[20], string2[20];
 
  printf("Please enter two strings: ");
  scanf("%s %s", string1, string2);
  if (substr(string1, string2)) 
    printf("%s is a substring of %s\n", string2, string1);
  else 
    printf("%s is not a substring of %s\n", string2, string1);

  return 0;
}

Whatâ€™s my horoscope again?

#include <stdio.h>
#include<stdlib.h>
#include<string.h>

int checkValidity(char *month, char *day, int *m, int *d) {
  int i;
 
  for (i=0; i<strlen(month); i++)
     if (month[i]<'0' || month[i]>'9')
        return 0;
  for (i=0; i<strlen(day); i++)
     if (day[i]<'0' || day[i]>'9')
        return 0;
  
  *m=atoi(month); *d=atoi(day);

  if (*m<1 || *m>12)
     return 0;
  if (*m==1||*m==3||*m==5||*m==7||*m==8||*m==10||*m==12) {
     if (*d<1 || *d>31) 
        return 0;
  }
  else if (*m==2) {
     if (*d<1 || *d>29)
        return 0;
  }
  else
     if (*d<1 || *d>30)
        return 0;

  return 1;
}
     


int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {

  int month, day;
  char *MonthNames[]={"January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"};

  if (argc!=3) {
    printf("Invalid number of command line arguments!\n");
    return 1;
  }
  if (!(checkValidity(argv[1], argv[2], &month, &day))) {
    printf("Invalid command line arguments!\n");
    return 1;
  }

  printf("The horoscope sign for %s %d is ", MonthNames[month-1], day);
  switch (month)
  {
    case 3:
       if (day >= 21)
          printf("Aries.\n");
       else
          printf("Pisces.\n");
       break;
    case 4:
       if (day >= 20)
          printf("Taurus.\n");
       else 
          printf("Aries.\n");
       break;
    case 5:
       if (day >= 21) 
          printf("Gemini.\n");
       else
          printf("Taurus.\n");
       break;
    case 6:
       if (day >= 22)
         printf("Cancer.\n");
       else
         printf("Gemini.\n");
       break;
    case 7:
       if (day >= 23)
         printf("Leo.\n");
       else 
         printf("Cancer.\n");
       break;
    case 8: 
       if (day >= 23)
         printf("Virgo.\n");
       else 
         printf("Leo.\n");
       break;
    case 9:
       if (day >=23)
         printf("Libra.\n");
       else 
         printf("Virgo.\n");
       break;
    case 10:
       if (day >=23)
         printf("Scorpio.\n");
       else 
         printf("Libra.\n");
       break;
    case 11:
       if (day >= 22)
         printf("Sagittarius.\n");
       else 
         printf("Scorpio.\n");
       break;
    case 12:
       if (day >= 22)
         printf("Capricorn.\n");
       else 
         printf("Sagittarius.\n");
       break;
    case 1:
       if (day >= 20)
         printf("Aquarius.\n");
       else
         printf("Capricorn.\n");
       break;
    case 2:
       if (day >= 19)
         printf("Pisces.\n");
       else 
         printf("Aquarius.\n");
       break;
  }
}

Structs

#include<stdio.h>
#include<stdlib.h>
#include<string.h>

struct student {
   char name[20];
   float gpa;
};

int main() {
  
  struct student *students, temp;

  int n, i, j, smallest_pos;

  printf("Please enter the number of students: ");
  scanf("%d", &n);
 
  if ((students=calloc(n, sizeof(struct student)))==NULL) {
     printf("Memory Allocation Failure!\n");
     return 1;
  };
  for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
    printf("Name: ");
    scanf("%s", students[i].name);
    printf("GPA: ");
    scanf("%f", &students[i].gpa);
  }
  
  for (i=0; i<n-1; i++) {
    smallest_pos=i;
    for (j=i+1; j<n; j++)
      if (strcmp(students[j].name, students[smallest_pos].name)<0) 
          smallest_pos=j;
    if (smallest_pos!=i) {
       temp=students[smallest_pos];
       students[smallest_pos]=students[i];
       students[i]=temp;
    }
  }

  printf("The sorted students are:\n");
  for (i=0; i<n; i++) 
    printf("%s %.1f\n", students[i].name, students[i].gpa);
  
  free(students);
}

Shell Script

#!/bin/sh

# Check usage
if [ $# -ne 1 ]
then
  echo "Usage: sh $0 filename" 
  exit 1
fi

# Check the existence of the input file
if [ ! -f $1 ]
then
  echo "File $1 does not exist" 
  exit 1
fi

# Check whether file is empty
if [ ! -s $1 ]
then
  echo "File $1 is empty" 
  exit 1
fi

while read lastname firstname midterm final major
do
  wm=`expr $midterm \* 4 / 10`
  wf=`expr $final \* 6 / 10`
  total=`expr $wm + $wf`
  if [ $total -ge 90 ]; then
    grade=A+
  elif [ $total -ge 80 ]; then
    grade=A
  elif [ $total -ge 75 ]; then
    grade=B+
  elif [ $total -ge 70 ]; then
    grade=B
  elif [ $total -ge 65 ]; then
    grade=C+
  elif [ $total -ge 60 ]; then
    grade=C
  elif [ $total -ge 55 ]; then 
    grade=D+
  elif [ $total -ge 50 ]; then
    grade=D
  elif [ $total -ge 40 ]; then
    grade=E
  else
    grade=F
  fi
  echo $major $lastname $firstname $total $grade 
done < $1 | 

sort -k1,1f -k4,4nr -k2,2f -k3,3f

exit 0

More Shell

#!/bin/sh

# Check usage
if [ $# -ne 2 ]
then
  echo "Usage: sh $0 filename major"
  exit 1
fi

# Check the existence of the input file
if [ ! -f $1 ]
then
  echo "File $1 does not exist"
  exit 1
fi

# Check whether file is empty
if [ ! -s $1 ]
then
  echo "File $1 is empty"
  exit 1
fi

count=0 countImprove=0 summ=0 sumf=0 
while read lastname firstname midterm final major
do
  if [ $major = $2 ]; then
     count=`expr $count + 1`
     summ=`expr $summ + $midterm`
     sumf=`expr $sumf + $final`
     if [ $final -gt $midterm ]; then
         countImprove=`expr $countImprove + 1` 
         echo "$lastname $firstname $midterm $final +"
     else
         echo $lastname $firstname $midterm $final 
     fi
  fi 
done  < $1 > temp.$$

sort -k1,1f -k2,2f temp.$$ 

if [ $count -eq 0 ]
then
   echo "There is no student whose major is $2."
else
   averagem=`expr $summ / $count`
   averagef=`expr $sumf / $count`
   echo "The average midterm mark of $2 students is $averagem."
   echo "The average final mark of $2 students is $averagef."
   echo "$countImprove students have improved their mark."
fi

if [ -f temp.$$ ]; then
  rm temp.$$
fi
 
exit 0

More Shell

#!/bin/sh
power()
{
 x=$1
 n=1
 while test $n -lt $2
 do
   x=`expr $x \* $1` 
   n=`expr $n + 1`
 done

 echo $x
}

if [ $# -ne 3 ]
then
  echo "Usage: sh $0 operand1 operator operand2" 
  exit 1
fi

if [ "$2" = '^' ] 
then 
  echo `power $1 $3`
elif [ "$2" = 'x' ] 
then 
  echo `expr $1 \* $3`
elif [ "$2" = '+' ] || [ "$2" = '-' ] || [ "$2" = '/' ] || [ "$2" = '%' ]
then
  echo `expr $1 $2 $3`
else
  echo Error: invalid operator
fi
